title: Ticket #3157: Blahp fails to handle some pbs job statuses
description:
When the blahp's pbs_status.sh script calls qstat to determine a job's status, if the status output is not something that the script is expecting, it prints an invalid classad back to the blahp. The blahp fails to parse the ad and sends the error message "Error allocating memory" to the gridmanager. The script doesn't expect several valid pbs job status letters: "W", "T", and "S".

For now, we'll fix the most pressing bug:

  • Not recognizing valid pbs statuses

These additional problems will be put off for later:

  • pbs_status.sh should return an error when encountering unexpected output, not return an invalid classad
  • When the blahp fails to parse an invalid classad, it should return a better error message than "Error allocating memory"

They would cause the script to return an invalid classad to the blahp, which would then return the error message "Error allocating memory" to the gridmanager. [...] (By Jaime Frey )
